required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Total Contact Insole for Chronic Nonspecific Low Back Pain (LBP)
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Total Contact Insole in Chronic Nonspecific Low Back Pain: a Randomized Controlled Trial

collaborator.agency: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico

brief_summary.textblock:
Non-specific low back pain is a common condition. Insoles are one of the many treatment form for chronic nonspecific LBP. The investigators hypothesized the contact total insole group will present pain reduction and functional improvement.
The aim of this study is to assess the effectiveness of contact total insole for people with nonspecific chronic low back pain and the impact of this insole on function, quality of life, load distribution in the plantar region, gait variables and satisfaction with insole use.

detailed_description.textblock: A randomized, controlled, double-blind, clinical trial with intent-to-treat analysis. Eighty-four patients with nonspecific chronic low back pain will be randomly into a study group and control group. One week following the baseline evaluation, the study group will receive a contact total insole made of ethyl vinyl acetate and the control group will receive a flat insole made of the same material, color and density. The groups will be evaluated after 6, 12 and 24 weeks of insole use. The following assessment parameters will be employed: low back pain numerical pain scale; functional capacity (Oswestry and roland morris questionnaire, six minute walk test and timed to up and go test); quality of life (Short Form-36) and foot pressure analysis using the AMCube FootWalk Pro program.

primary_outcome.measure: Low back of pain intensity measured with Numeric Pain Rating Scale
primary_outcome.description: It will be measured by the Brazilian version of the Numeric Pain Rating Scale 10 cm. The Numeric Pain Rating Scale goes from 0 to 10, where 0 is "no pain" and 10 is "the worst pain imaginable." Participants will be asked to answer about their pain levels based on the last week. Change in pain score or an improvement of 2 levels or more is accepted as clinically relevant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional capacity measured with Oswestry Disability Index
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Oswestry Disability Index score. Ranging from 0 to 100 with higher values represent a worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional capacity measured with Roland Morris Disability
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Roland Morris Disability score. Ranging from 0 to 24 with higher values represent a worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional capacity measured with the 6-minute walk test
secondary_outcome.description: Change in 6-minute walk test. The amount of meters walked in 6 minutes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional capacity measured with the timed to up and go test
secondary_outcome.description: Change in timed to up and go test. Amount of time that the patient takes to rise from a chair, walk three meters, turn around, walk back to the chair, and sit down.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life measured with Short form-36 questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Short form-36 questionnaire score. Ranging from 0 to 100 with higher scores showing a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient's global impression of recovery measured with a likert scale
secondary_outcome.description: The Likert scale. The patients answered the question 'After starting the use the insoles, how do you think your low back is?' with one of the following statements: much worse, a little worse, unchanged, a little better, much better.
Amount of paracetamol (500mg) consumed by patient between the evaluation times

secondary_outcome.measure: Foot pressure analysis using the AMCube FootWalk Pro program

arm_group.description: Ethyl vinyl acetate insole shaped in the cast of the patient's foot, every 6 months.
Flat insole made the same material ethyl vinyl acetate, every 6 months.

intervention.description: Ethyl vinyl acetate insole shaped in the cast of the patient's foot.
Flat insole made of the same material ethyl vinyl acetate
intervention.other_name: Ethyl vinyl acetate flat insole group

responsible_party.investigator_title: Head of Rheumatology Rehabilitation Section - Rheumatology Division
